response: "{ \"title\": \"Reverse Words (Easy)\", \"description\": \"Write a function `reverse_words` that takes a string as input and returns the string with all its words reversed.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef reverse_words(s: str) -> str:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `s` (str): A string containing one or more words separated by spaces.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the input string with all its words reversed in order.\\n\", \"code\": \"def reverse_words(s: str) -> str:\\n    # Split the string into words\\n    words = s.split()\\n    # Reverse the list of words\\n    words = words[::-1]\\n    # Join the reversed words back together with spaces in between\\n    return ' '.join(words)\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert reverse_words(\\\"Hello world\\\") == \\\"world Hello\\\"\", \"assert reverse_words(\\\"Python is awesome\\\") == \\\"awesome is Python\\\"\", \"assert reverse_words(\\\"Reverse these words\\\") == \\\"words these Reverse\\\"\"] }"
